p: This is the first study that selects EOs with antimicrobial activity against several S. suis strains. The essential oils of oregano, red thyme, common thyme and cinnamon showed a notable in vitro bactericidal activity, by vapor and/or direct contact. The essential oils could be used alone or in combination with antimicrobial agents to control multidrug‐resistant bacteria, although more in vivo studies on the safety and the effect of essential oils are needed.
